cardDescription: I am currently developing a new website for the Satakuntalainen Osakunta. The new website is needed to address various issues. We are using a combination of Next.js, Firebase, Google Cloud API, DirectusCMS
imageAltText: a snapshot of the Satakuntalainen Osakunta's new website

cardDescription: During the 48-hour Solve the SDGs hackathon at Aalto University, our team developed a platform targeting SDG 4.7 to engage university students in sustainable development. I served as frontend-focused full-stack developer, set up the CI/CD pipeline for seamless teamwork, and acted as a pseudo-Scrum master.
imageAltText: a snapshot of the green future project

cardDescription: During the 48-hour Solve the SDGs hackathon at Aalto University, our team developed a platform targeting SDG 4.7 to engage university students in sustainable development. I served as frontend-focused full-stack developer, set up the CI/CD pipeline for seamless teamwork, and acted as a pseudo-Scrum master.
imageAltText: a snapshot of the green future project

cardDescription: BRiDG3 24Hack Category Winner: In just 24 hours our team launched a website that allowed the students at Tampere University to find, add, and rate their courses based on content, quality, and workload. Students could then search and filter to find courses that met their expectations (easiest, highest quality, etc).
imageAltText: a snapshot of the OMG project

cardDescription: For a project work course, my team and I created an administrative tool for Sibelius Academy, where I contributed to frontend development, backend development, and unit testing.
imageAltText: a snapshot of the Sibelius Academy project

cardDescription: YetiType is a typing racing game inspired by MonkeyType, with a fun frosty twist. This was my final project for a backend development course. I decided to develop a type racing game that uses code snippets, aiming to improve my typing speed while incorporating special characters.
imageAltText: a snapshot of the YetiType project
